1.label: Upper paddle buttons mode
1.description: Configuration of Pair Mode for the upper two buttons (button #1 and #2).

options.label: Toggle mode
In pair mode

2.label: Lower paddle buttons mode
2.description: Configuration of Pair Mode for the lower two buttons (button #3 and #4).

7.label: LED #1 brightness level
7.description: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is on.

8.label: LED #2 brightness level
8.description: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is on.

9.label: LED #3 brightness level
9.description: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is on.

10.label: LED #4 brightness level
10.description: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is on.

11.label: LED #1 off brightness level
11.description: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is off.

12.label: LED #2 off brightness level
12.description: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is off.

13.label: LED #3 off brightness level
13.description: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is off.

14.label: LED #4 off brightness level
14.description: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is off.

15.label: Relay mode
15.description: This parameter configures which of the buttons that shall control the built-in relay, or if the relay only will be activated for one second, each time button #1 is used.

options.label: Relay is disabled
Relay is controlled by button #1 or by upper paddle when pair mode is active
Relay is controlled by button #2 or by upper paddle when pair mode is active
Relay is controlled by button #3 or by lower paddle when pair mode is active
Relay is controlled by button #4 or by lower paddle when pair mode is active
Relay is activated for half a second and is controlled by button #1 or by upper paddle when pair mode is active
Relay is activated for half a second and is controlled by button #2 or by upper paddle when pair mode is active
Relay is activated for half a second and is controlled by button #3 or by lower paddle when pair mode is active
Relay is activated for half a second and is controlled by button #4 or by lower paddle when pair mode is active
Relay follows the state of button #1; when button is down the relay is on and when button is released the relay is off
Relay follows the state of button #2; when button is down the relay is on and when button is released the relay is off
Relay follows the state of button #3; when button is down the relay is on and when button is released the relay is off
Relay follows the state of button #4; when button is down the relay is on and when button is released the relay is off
Relay is only controlled by commands sent to the root device (instance 0). Commands to the root device will not be forwarded to instance 1

16.label: Indicator mode
16.description: When ZHC5010 receives an Indicator Set message, then the received value can be used only to set the current light level for the actual LED or the level value can be stored and will then be used for subsequent internal activations.

options.label: Only used to control the LED
Also used by internal LED activations

17.label: Scene notification offset
17.description:
0     : Scene notifications are turned off.
			1-200 : Button #1 will send scene [value], button #2 will send scene [value] + 1, button #3 will send scene [value] + 2, button #4 will send scene [value] + 3

18.label: House Cleaning Mode
18.description: This parameter is able to enable or disable the so-called "House Cleaning Mode", where ZHC5010 is able send a dimming command in order to set the level of the lights to 100%.

options.label: Enabled
Disabled

19.label: Multilevel Switch on single press for button 1
19.description:
Byte 1: Enable / Disable
				0: Disabled - When single pressing the button, nodes associated to group 6 won't be switched
				1: Enabled - When single pressing the button, nodes associated to group 6 will be switched between the configured upper and lower switch values. (Default)
			Byte 2: Upper Switch Value
				0 - 99, 255 When single pressing the button for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 6. (Default = 255)
			Byte 3: Lower Switch Value
				When single pressing the button for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 6. (Default = 0)
			Byte 4: Not used - must be set to 0.
			Default: 33488896

20.label: Multilevel Switch on single press for button 2
20.description:
Byte 1: Enable / Disable
						0: Disabled - When single pressing the button, nodes associated to group 6 won't be switched
						1: Enabled - When single pressing the button, nodes associated to group 6 will be switched between the configured upper and lower switch values. (Default)
				Byte 2: Upper Switch Value
						0 - 99, 255 When single pressing the button for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 6. (Default = 255)
				Byte 3: Lower Switch Value
						When single pressing the button for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 6. (Default = 0)
				Byte 4: Not used - must be set to 0.
				Default: 33488896

21.label: Multilevel Switch on single press for button 3
21.description:
Byte 1: Enable / Disable
						0: Disabled - When single pressing the button, nodes associated to group 6 won't be switched
						1: Enabled - When single pressing the button, nodes associated to group 6 will be switched between the configured upper and lower switch values. (Default)
				Byte 2: Upper Switch Value
						0 - 99, 255 When single pressing the button for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 6. (Default = 255)
				Byte 3: Lower Switch Value
						When single pressing the button for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 6. (Default = 0)
				Byte 4: Not used - must be set to 0.
				Default: 33488896

22.label: Multilevel Switch on single press for button 4
22.description:
Byte 1: Enable / Disable
					0: Disabled - When single pressing the button, nodes associated to group 6 won't be switched
					1: Enabled - When single pressing the button, nodes associated to group 6 will be switched between the configured upper and lower switch values. (Default)
			Byte 2: Upper Switch Value
					0 - 99, 255 When single pressing the button for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 6. (Default = 255)
			Byte 3: Lower Switch Value
					When single pressing the button for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 6. (Default = 0)
			Byte 4: Not used - must be set to 0.
				Default: 33488896

23.label: Control of association groups for button 1
23.description: Enable or disable if received commands are relayed to the nodes in the association groups received by device 1.

options.label: When commands are received by device 1, nodes in the association groups will not be switched, button activations will still send switch values
When commands are received by deivce 1, nodes in the association groups will be switched

24.label: Control of association groups for button 2
24.description: Enable or disable if received commands are relayed to the nodes in the association groups received by device 2.

options.label: When commands are received by device 2, nodes in the association groups will not be switched, button activations will still send switch values
When commands are received by device 2, nodes in the association groups will be switched

25.label: Control of association groups for button 3
25.description: Enable or disable if received commands are relayed to the nodes in the association groups received by device 3.

options.label: When commands are received by device 3, nodes in the association groups will not be switched, button activations will still send switch values
When commands are received by device 3, nodes in the association groups will be switched

26.label: Control of association groups for button 4
26.description: Enable or disable if received commands are relayed to the nodes in the association groups received by device 4.

options.label: When commands are received by device 4, nodes in the association groups will not be switched, button activations will still send switch values
When commands are received by device 4, nodes in the association groups will be switched

28.label: Threshold time for long-press
28.description:
Decides the time for when a button is detected as long-pressed.
			0     : Detection disabled. This is not recommended.
			1-255 : Long-press detection time in 0.01 seconds, 50 equals 0.5 seconds.

29.label: Threshold time for keypress detection of button 1
29.description:
Specifies the detection time for single-press, double-press, etc. for button 1.
			0       : Detection disabled. This is not recommended.
			1 - 255 : Detection time in 0.01 seconds, 30 equals 0.3 seconds.
				Default: 30

30.label: Threshold time for keypress detection of button 2
30.description:
Specifies the detection time for single-press, double-press, etc. for button 2.
			0       : Detection disabled. This is not recommended.
			1 - 255 : Detection time in 0.01 seconds, 30 equals 0.3 seconds.
				Default: 30

31.label: Threshold time for keypress detection of button 3
31.description:
Specifies the detection time for single-press, double-press, etc. for button 3.
			0       : Detection disabled. This is not recommended.
			1 - 255 : Detection time in 0.01 seconds, 30 equals 0.3 seconds.
				Default: 30

32.label: Threshold time for keypress detection of button 4
32.description:
Specifies the detection time for single-press, double-press, etc. for button 4.
			0       : Detection disabled. This is not recommended.
			1 - 255 : Detection time in 0.01 seconds, 30 equals 0.3 seconds.
				Default: 30

33.label: Non-secure commands for AG in logical device 1
33.description:
If ZHC5010 is included secure, this parameter allows sending messages on keypresses to non-secure devices (e.g. pre-gen5 relays).
			If ZHC5010 is included non-secure, this parameter has no function.
			0         : No commands sent unencrypted (default)
			1  (0x01) : Bit#1. Not used.
			2  (0x02) : Bit#2. Send BASICREPORT to association group 2 unencrypted.
			4  (0x04) : Bit#3. Send BASICSET to association group 3 unencrypted.
			8  (0x08) : Bit#4. Send BINARYSWITCHSET to association group 4 unencrypted.
			16 (0x10) : Bit#5. Send BINARYTOGGLESWITCHSET to association group 5 unencrypted.
			32 (0x20) : Bit#6. Send MULTILEVELSWITCH to association group 6 unencrypted.

34.label: Non-secure commands for AG in logical device 2
34.description:
If ZHC5010 is included secure, this parameter allows sending messages on keypresses to non-secure devices (e.g. pre-gen5 relays).
			If ZHC5010 is included non-secure, this parameter has no function.
			0         : No commands sent unencrypted (default)
			1  (0x01) : Bit#1. Not used.
			2  (0x02) : Bit#2. Send BASICREPORT to association group 2 unencrypted.
			4  (0x04) : Bit#3. Send BASICSET to association group 3 unencrypted.
			8  (0x08) : Bit#4. Send BINARYSWITCHSET to association group 4 unencrypted.
			16 (0x10) : Bit#5. Send BINARYTOGGLESWITCHSET to association group 5 unencrypted.
			32 (0x20) : Bit#6. Send MULTILEVELSWITCH to association group 6 unencrypted.
